tests.name: tests/integration/test_basic_usage.py::TestWeatherWorkflows::test_trip_planning_compare_destinations
tests.docstring:
Plan a trip: get forecasts for two cities and recommend the better one.

        This tests:
        - Multiple forecast calls (one per city)
        - Reasoning across retrieved data
        - Synthesizing a recommendation
        - AI judge for semantic validation

turns.content: I'm planning a trip next week and can't decide between Paris and Sydney. Get me a 3-day forecast for both cities and recommend which has better weather for sightseeing. I prefer sunny weather.

I pulled 3-day forecasts for both cities. Here are the day-by-day details, then a recommendation based on your preference for sunny weather.

Paris (3-day forecast)
- Day 1: Sunny â€” high 20Â°C / low 12Â°C â€” precipitation chance 20%
- Day 2: Partly cloudy â€” high 21Â°C / low 13Â°C â€” precipitation chance 30%
- Day 3: Cloudy â€” high 22Â°C / low 14Â°C â€” precipitation chance 40%

Sydney (3-day forecast)
- Day 1: Sunny â€” high 28Â°C / low 20Â°C â€” precipitation chance 20%
- Day 2: Partly cloudy â€” high 29Â°C / low 21Â°C â€” precipitation chance 30%
- Day 3: Cloudy â€” high 30Â°C / low 22Â°C â€” precipitation chance 40%

Recommendation
- Both cities show the same pattern: one sunny day, one partly cloudy, then one cloudy day, with similar chances of precipitation. If your top priority is sunny conditions, Sydney will feel sunnier overall because itâ€™s substantially warmer (bright, beach-friendly sunshine). 
- If you prefer milder temperatures for walking and sightseeing (less heat), Paris is the better choice â€” still pleasant and with a sunny day as well.

Quick packing tips
- If you pick Sydney: bring sunscreen, a hat, sunglasses, light breathable clothing and water for walking.
- If you pick Paris: pack a light jacket/layers and a compact umbrella or light rain jacket.

Want me to check the same 3-day forecast for specific travel dates next week or look at hourly plans for the sunniest times in either city?

turns.content: I'm traveling to London and Berlin this week. Check the weather in both cities and tell me if I should pack an umbrella or rain jacket.

I checked the 7-day forecasts for both cities.

Quick summary
- London: several mild days (highs 16â€“18Â°C, lows 8â€“10Â°C). One day is explicitly listed as "Rainy" (day 4) with a ~50% chance of precipitation; a few other days show 30â€“40% chance.
- Berlin: similar pattern and temperatures slightly warmer (highs 18â€“20Â°C, lows 10â€“12Â°C). One day is listed "Rainy" (day 4) with ~50% precipitation chance; other days show 30â€“40% chance.

Recommendation
- Pack both a compact umbrella and a lightweight waterproof (or water-resistant) jacket. The umbrella is handy for brief, calm showers; a rain jacket is better if itâ€™s windy or youâ€™ll be walking a lot.
- Temperatures are mild, so a light waterproof layer should be enough (no heavy winter coat needed).

Quick packing checklist
- Small foldable umbrella
- Lightweight waterproof/rain jacket (breathable if youâ€™ll be active)
- A thin layer (sweater/light fleece) for cooler mornings/evenings
- Water-resistant shoes or an extra pair in case one gets wet

If you tell me the exact dates youâ€™ll be in each city, I can give a day-by-day recommendation for those travel days.

agent_result.final_response:
I checked the 7-day forecasts for both cities.

Quick summary
- London: several mild days (highs 16â€“18Â°C, lows 8â€“10Â°C). One day is explicitly listed as "Rainy" (day 4) with a ~50% chance of precipitation; a few other days show 30â€“40% chance.
- Berlin: similar pattern and temperatures slightly warmer (highs 18â€“20Â°C, lows 10â€“12Â°C). One day is listed "Rainy" (day 4) with ~50% precipitation chance; other days show 30â€“40% chance.

Recommendation
- Pack both a compact umbrella and a lightweight waterproof (or water-resistant) jacket. The umbrella is handy for brief, calm showers; a rain jacket is better if itâ€™s windy or youâ€™ll be walking a lot.
- Temperatures are mild, so a light waterproof layer should be enough (no heavy winter coat needed).

Quick packing checklist
- Small foldable umbrella
- Lightweight waterproof/rain jacket (breathable if youâ€™ll be active)
- A thin layer (sweater/light fleece) for cooler mornings/evenings
- Water-resistant shoes or an extra pair in case one gets wet

If you tell me the exact dates youâ€™ll be in each city, I can give a day-by-day recommendation for those travel days.

tests.name: tests/integration/test_basic_usage.py::TestWeatherWorkflows::test_comparative_analysis_three_cities
tests.docstring:
Compare weather across three cities and rank them.

        This tests:
        - Multiple tool calls (3+ cities)
        - Comparative reasoning
        - Structured output (ranking)

turns.content: Compare the current weather in Tokyo, Berlin, and New York. Rank them from warmest to coldest and explain the conditions.

Ranked warmest â†’ coldest
1) Tokyo â€” 24Â°C (75Â°F). Sunny, humidity 70%, light E wind 8 km/h. Clear sun makes it the warmest now; higher humidity will make it feel a bit muggy.
2) New York â€” 22Â°C (72Â°F). Clear, humidity 55%, NW wind 15 km/h. Slightly cooler than Tokyo but lower humidity and a stronger breeze make it feel comfortable.
3) Berlin â€” 16Â°C (61Â°F). Overcast, humidity 72%, N wind 10 km/h. Cloud cover and cooler northern airflow explain why itâ€™s notably cooler than Tokyo and New York.

If youâ€™d like, I can give "feels like" temperatures, a short-term forecast for each city, or show the same comparison with temperatures in only Celsius or Fahrenheit.

agent_result.final_response:
Ranked warmest â†’ coldest
1) Tokyo â€” 24Â°C (75Â°F). Sunny, humidity 70%, light E wind 8 km/h. Clear sun makes it the warmest now; higher humidity will make it feel a bit muggy.
2) New York â€” 22Â°C (72Â°F). Clear, humidity 55%, NW wind 15 km/h. Slightly cooler than Tokyo but lower humidity and a stronger breeze make it feel comfortable.
3) Berlin â€” 16Â°C (61Â°F). Overcast, humidity 72%, N wind 10 km/h. Cloud cover and cooler northern airflow explain why itâ€™s notably cooler than Tokyo and New York.
